Description:
Some careers shine brighter than others.If you’re looking for a career that will help you stand out, join HSBC and fulfil your potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further. HSBC is one of the largest banking and financial services organisations in the world, with operations in 64 countries and territories. We aim to be where the growth is, enabling businesses to thrive and economies to prosper, and, ultimately, helping people to fulfil their hopes and realise their ambitions.We are currently seeking an experienced professional to join our team in the role of Legal CounselWhy join us?Global Banking and Markets (GBM) Legal provides support to the GBM businesses. The main GBM businesses are Banking, Markets, Capital Financing, Securities Services and the shared products of Global Trade and Receivables Finance, and Payments and Global Liquidity & Cash Management. The Global Legal Services – Banking Products team is part of the GBM Legal Department and provides advice, guidance, and support to Global Banking and CMB by negotiating loan documentation such as bilateral uncommitted facilities/overdrafts, bilateral committed facilities, syndicated facility agreements, guarantees and guarantee confirmation letters, ancillary CP documentation and other industry-standard documentation. The team focusses on negotiating documentation in a streamlined manner that provides appropriate credit and legal protection for the Bank.The Opportunity:The role holder, Legal Counsel, Bangalore is responsible for the day to day operations and delivery of a new India-based branch of the Loan Negotiation Team and is responsible for managing the legal risk and execution of a suite of documents, which will increase over time as part of the broader offshoring strategy of the Global Legal Function.The role holder is responsible for the drafting and negotiating of the various types of agreement, as well as projects involving legal research for a global network of stakeholders.Role Holder is accountable to the completion of tasks which includes but not limited to:Negotiation Support/Legal Drafting
Promote a strong sense of teamwork to ensure all areas work collaborative and as efficiently as possible
Ensure the team’s priorities are aligned with Senior Management priorities
Change Management
Technology / Workflow
Process Re-engineering
Ad-hoc projects within GBM LegalGiven the unique position of being in the GSC, the individual will be required to bring standardization, where possible, across the documentation process across regions and therefore requires an individual to have the drive to establish and share best practices.As a SME, acts as the second point of contact for any query the onshore legal negotiation team might have, and advises senior management in strategic decisions relating to process and generic operations and workflow management.What you’ll do:Responsible for work load management and delivery of volumes and quality which will include assigning and allocation of tasks in timely and in an accurate manner
Effective and timely communication of matters requiring consideration and decision to the Regional Heads and Global Head of the function
Motivating the team to achieve team goals as well as Onboarding targets
Shall engage very closely with senior stakeholders across product categories and client management within associated functions in charting out a very effective documentation process including definition of fully aligned desk instruction manual across all stakeholders who are involved in the process along with service and performance level agreements
Following appropriate processes, procedures and understanding statutory and regulatory obligations
Demonstrate  creativity, defect free implementation of procedures and maintain high productivity levels through continuous improvement
Fulfill appropriate training & development requirements and to lead and motivate staff with differing aspirations working in productivity based environment where deadlines are critical
Developing and maintaining information flows to and within the GLS Banking Products Regional teams
Implementing and following drafting and negotiating best practices
Ensuring costs and expenses are met by the relevant business/cost code wherever possible
Suggesting improved processes to increase efficiency, control costs and avoid operational losses within the Department
Addressing any areas of concern in conjunction with line management and/or the appropriate department
Working closely with and influencing internal stakeholders and SMEs globally
Senior stakeholder management
Delivery of a high quality service with a complex set of activities against the backdrop of both the external legal and regulatory framework and the internal control framework of the Group Standards Manual Working in a pressurized, time sensitive environmentJob Details
